sub_title: Subject Area Coordinator and Teacher at International School Utrecht
summary: I am a History teacher with over a decade experience teaching at the secondary level, and also a consultant for and designer of educational programming. I have crafted extensive curricula on world history and cultures while simultaneously emphasizing development of analytical reading and expository writing skills. I seek work that will engage my interests in questions that pertain to historical and contemporary world events, material culture, and social justice. I am American with Dutch residency.

education.field_of_study: Instructional Leadership; Area: Secondary Social Science Education

International Criminal Court, The Hague						
December 2017—Present
May 2017—July 2017	

• Engineering rollout of new program for student visits to the ICC, including coordinating pre- and post-visit with sponsoring teachers to prepare students and teachers and assess the quality of the experience; leading student tours as part of testing phase; assessing strengths and weaknesses of program, and making recommendations for changes and further development of resources for 16-18 year olds.

profile_positions.description: Preparing and delivering lessons for VWO level English, and English language VWO and HAVO level History classes, as part of a dual language Dutch-English program (Dutch TTO: Twee Talige Onderwijs).
profile_positions.title: Docent, English and History

profile_positions.description:
• Constructed a visitor experience for school groups of students aged 16-18 visiting the ICC that included materials and activities to accompany and enhance the experience, and pre- and post- visit lesson plans.
• Developed pedagogical framework and advising on content for a new youth education outreach program targeting students aged 12-18.
• Reviewed current lesson plans for students aged 16-18 hosted by the ICC website, and developed a plan for the expansion and deepening of their content.
• Liaised with vendors to produce VR and AR simulations, and with museums’ and organizations’ youth education program directors to explore potential collaboration and model youth programs.

company.name: Oak Park and River Forest High School

profile_positions.company: Oak Park and River Forest High School
profile_positions.description:
Teaching Responsibilities and Curriculum Development 
• Instructed: 
  • World History at three distinct academic levels: Honors*, College Prep, and Basic (US grades 9/10, mixed)
  • Asian Studies (US grades 10-12, mixed)
  • The Modern Middle East* (US grades 11-12, mixed)
  • World Studies: interdisciplinary History-English course co-taught and developed with English teacher (US grade 9)
    (*denotes a rigorous course taught at the highest academic level)
• Created a non-textbook-based Humanities curriculum for untracked Asian Studies elective 
• Redesigned honors World History course away from traditional Eurocentric model to emphasize global interactions and the rise of the West within the context of world developments. 
• Constructed History curriculum units on teaching about women in China, the Pacific War and memory in Japan, and the nuclear “crisis” in North Korea (graduate-level coursework undertaken through Indiana University with the National Council for the Teaching of Asia, Spring 2007)
• Produced bibliography of academic sources on women in China, “Beyond Mulan and Footbinding: Women in China.”  (graduate-level research project undertaken through Indiana University for the National Council for the Teaching of Asia, Summer 2007)

Departmental and School Responsibilities
• Led Teacher Collaboration Team: Guided weekly meetings and rotating responsibilities, compiled yearly reports (2011-2012, 2013-2014)
• Chaired World History Honors Textbook Adoption Committee: selected books for comparison, compiled and submitted document outlining arguments for selected text (Winter 2008-2009)
• Elected member of History Division Chair Hiring Committee (Spring 2007)
• Advised Students for Peace and Justice: supported weekly meetings, worked with leadership committee to develop agendas and instill democratic decision making processes, accompanied students to events
• Advised Feminist Society: assisted bi-weekly meetings
profile_positions.title: History Teacher

profile_positions.description:
• Managed fiscal aspects of multi-million dollar grant, including tracking grant expenditures and purchasing equipment.
• Drafted reports detailing financial activities; composed official correspondence with sponsoring institution.
• Developed Excel database to track grant expenditures.
• Planned and coordinated all aspects of visits to Northwestern University of Program Officers from the Mellon Foundation and colleagues from cooperating Chinese institution the Dunhuang Research Academy.
• Coordinated conference logistics (conference rooms, technological support, meals, visitor parking)
• Coordinated travel to Dunhuang, China three times per year for teams of 10-15 technicians and photographers, and equipment.  
• Supervised part-time accountant.
• Participated in photo acquisition trip to Dunhuang, China (July—August 2001).
profile_positions.title: Program Coordinator
